intro: Justicia santapaui, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its bright colors and nectar-rich blooms. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes due to its vibrant appearance and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
